attributes.action: Vote for early General Election under the Fixed-Term Parliament Act 2011.
attributes.additional_details: The people, whether Conservative supporters or otherwise have shown no confidence in either Ms May or Ms Leadsom's ability to lead the country and in light of other political calamities made by the Conservative Party, the people request that the British Government vote for a two third majority to force an early General Election as laid out in the relevant legislation; the Fixed-Term Parliament Act 2011.
attributes.background: In 2015, a Conservative Government was voted to power with David Cameron as Prime Minister.  Within a little over a year, the British public have now been faced with a Government headed by a non-elected official. An entirely undemocratic, and dictatorial move.
